---
title: "K mean Clustering with image"
subtitle: "with image data"

author: "Tony Duan"


execute:
  warning: false
  error: false
format:
  html:
    toc: true
    toc-location: right
    code-fold: show
    code-tools: true
    number-sections: true
    code-block-bg: true
    code-block-border-left: "#31BAE9"
---


Using K mean Clustering to replace colow on below picture


# load package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(55)
library(tidyverse)
library(broom)
library(janitor)
library(magick)
```
:::


# RBG no alpha channel picture:

## input image

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image <- image_read('images/python logo.jpg')
```
:::



## convert png to matrix

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_tiff <- image_convert(image, "tiff")
image_array <- as.integer(image_tiff[[1]])                
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
magick::image_read(image_array/ 255)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=107}
:::
:::


235 * 214 pixcel and 3 channels

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 235 214   3
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "array"
```


:::
:::


Data Normalization

Since the dataset contains a range of values from 0 to 255, the dataset has to be normalized. Data Normalization is an important preprocessing step which ensures that each input parameter (pixel, in this case) has a similar data distribution. This fastens the process of covergence while training the model. Also Normalization makes sure no one particular parameter influences the output significantly.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_array=image_array/255
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_array_old=image_array
```
:::


## reshape from 3 D to 2 D

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array) <- c(dim(image_array)[1]*dim(image_array)[2],3)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 50290     3
```


:::
:::


## Optimal number of k-clusters



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kclusts <- 
  tibble(k = 1:9) %>%
  mutate(
    kclust = map(k, ~kmeans(image_array, .x)),
    tidied = map(kclust, tidy),
    glanced = map(kclust, glance),
    augmented = map(kclust, augment, image_array)
  )

kclusts
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 9 × 5
      k kclust   tidied           glanced          augmented            
  <int> <list>   <list>           <list>           <list>               
1     1 <kmeans> <tibble [1 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
2     2 <kmeans> <tibble [2 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
3     3 <kmeans> <tibble [3 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
4     4 <kmeans> <tibble [4 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
5     5 <kmeans> <tibble [5 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
6     6 <kmeans> <tibble [6 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
7     7 <kmeans> <tibble [7 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
8     8 <kmeans> <tibble [8 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
9     9 <kmeans> <tibble [9 × 6]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [50,290 × 4]>
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
clusters <- 
  kclusts %>%
  unnest(cols = c(tidied))

assignments <- 
  kclusts %>% 
  unnest(cols = c(augmented))

clusterings <- 
  kclusts %>%
  unnest(cols = c(glanced))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(scales)
ggplot(clusterings, aes(k, tot.withinss)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point()+scale_x_continuous(breaks= pretty_breaks())+scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::




## group to 3 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kclust <- kmeans(image_array, centers = 3)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result=augment(kclust, image_array) %>% clean_names()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result %>% count(cluster)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  cluster     n
  <fct>   <int>
1 1       13560
2 2       13631
3 3       23099
```


:::
:::


## change  2 color

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# black RGB code 0 0 0
# red RGB code 255 0 0

result2=result %>%mutate(x1=if_else(cluster==3,0,x1) 
                          ,x2=if_else(cluster==3,0,x2) 
                          ,x3=if_else(cluster==3,0,x3) 
                          )%>%mutate(x1=if_else(cluster==1,255,x1) 
                          ,x2=if_else(cluster==1,0,x2) 
                          ,x3=if_else(cluster==1,0,x3)) %>% select(-cluster)
```
:::


## convert 2 D back to 3 D

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result2arrary=array(unlist(result2),c(dim(image_array_old)[1],dim(image_array_old)[2],3))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(result2arrary)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 235 214   3
```


:::
:::


convert from 0-1 back to 0-255


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result2arrary=result2arrary*255
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
magick::image_read(result2arrary/ 255)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=107}
:::
:::




# RBG with alpha channel picture:




## input image

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image <- image_read('images/R_logo.png')
```
:::



## convert png to matrix

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_tiff <- image_convert(image, "tiff")
image_array <- as.integer(image_tiff[[1]])                
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
magick::image_read(image_array/ 255)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=362}
:::
:::

561 * 724 pixcel and 4 channels

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 561 724   4
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
class(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] "array"
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_array_old=image_array
```
:::


## reshape from 3 D to 2 D

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array) <- c(dim(image_array)[1]*dim(image_array)[2],4)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(image_array)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 406164      4
```


:::
:::


Data Normalization

Since the dataset contains a range of values from 0 to 255, the dataset has to be normalized. Data Normalization is an important preprocessing step which ensures that each input parameter (pixel, in this case) has a similar data distribution. This fastens the process of covergence while training the model. Also Normalization makes sure no one particular parameter influences the output significantly.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
image_array=image_array/255
```
:::





## Optimal number of k-clusters



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kclusts <- 
  tibble(k = 1:9) %>%
  mutate(
    kclust = map(k, ~kmeans(image_array, .x)),
    tidied = map(kclust, tidy),
    glanced = map(kclust, glance),
    augmented = map(kclust, augment, image_array)
  )

kclusts
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 9 × 5
      k kclust   tidied           glanced          augmented             
  <int> <list>   <list>           <list>           <list>                
1     1 <kmeans> <tibble [1 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
2     2 <kmeans> <tibble [2 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
3     3 <kmeans> <tibble [3 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
4     4 <kmeans> <tibble [4 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
5     5 <kmeans> <tibble [5 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
6     6 <kmeans> <tibble [6 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
7     7 <kmeans> <tibble [7 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
8     8 <kmeans> <tibble [8 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
9     9 <kmeans> <tibble [9 × 7]> <tibble [1 × 4]> <tibble [406,164 × 5]>
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
clusters <- 
  kclusts %>%
  unnest(cols = c(tidied))

assignments <- 
  kclusts %>% 
  unnest(cols = c(augmented))

clusterings <- 
  kclusts %>%
  unnest(cols = c(glanced))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(scales)
ggplot(clusterings, aes(k, tot.withinss)) +
  geom_line() +
  geom_point()+scale_x_continuous(breaks= pretty_breaks())+scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-33-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::




## group to 3 


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
kclust <- kmeans(image_array, centers = 3)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result=augment(kclust, image_array) %>% clean_names()
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result %>% count(cluster)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  cluster      n
  <fct>    <int>
1 1       120865
2 2       169342
3 3       115957
```


:::
:::


## change  2 color

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# black RGB code 0 0 0
# red RGB code 255 0 0

result2=result %>%mutate(x1=if_else(cluster==3,0,x1) 
                          ,x2=if_else(cluster==3,0,x2) 
                          ,x3=if_else(cluster==3,0,x3) 
                          )%>%mutate(x1=if_else(cluster==1,255,x1) 
                          ,x2=if_else(cluster==1,0,x2) 
                          ,x3=if_else(cluster==1,0,x3)) %>% select(-cluster)
```
:::


## convert 2 D back to 4 D

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result2arrary=array(unlist(result2),c(dim(image_array_old)[1],dim(image_array_old)[2],4))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dim(result2arrary)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 561 724   4
```


:::
:::


convert from 0-1 back to 0-255


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
result2arrary=result2arrary*255
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
magick::image_read(result2arrary/ 255)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](1.2-k-mean-Clustering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-41-1.png){width=362}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
img <- magick::image_read(result2arrary / 255)

image_write(img, path = "final.png", format = "png")
```
:::


# reference:

https://www.r-bloggers.com/2014/09/r-k-means-clustering-on-an-image/#google_vignette
